home.what_is_corona_answer: Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans.  In humans, several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).
home.what_is_corona_punch: The most recently discovered coronavirus causes coronavirus disease COVID-19.
home.handwash: Wash your hands frequently for at least 20 seconds
home.cover_face: Always cover your face while snizzing
home.dont_touch_face: Do not touch your face with your hand
home.handrub: Use an alcohol based sanitiser when handwash is not an option
home.social_distancing: Practice home quarantine and social distancing
home.mask: Wear a mask if you have cold or flu like symptoms

sd.what_is_sd_ans: Social distancing is deliberately increasing the physical space between people to avoid spreading illness. Staying at least six feet away from other people lessens your chances of catching COVID-19.
sd.what_is_sd_ans-2: Examples of social distancing that allow you to avoid larger crowds or crowded spaces are:
sd.what_is_sd_ans-2-opt1: Working from home instead of at the office
sd.what_is_sd_ans-2-opt2: Closing schools or switching to online classes
sd.what_is_sd_ans-2-opt3: Visiting loved ones by electronic devices instead of in person
sd.what_is_sd_ans-2-opt4: Cancelling or postponing conferences and large meetings
sd.jan_curfew_message: Janata Curfew: It's a voluntary effort of self quarantine to fight the spread of coronavirus. Stay Home. Stay Safe.
sd.jan_curfew_submessage: Everyone is advised to stay indoors and practice self quarantine.

sq.what_is_sq_ans: People who have been exposed to the new coronavirus and who are at risk for coming down with COVID-19 might practice self-quarantine. Health experts recommend that self-quarantine lasts 14 days. Two weeks provides enough time for them to know whether or not they will become ill and be contagious to other people.
sq.what_is_sq_ans-2: You might be asked to practice self-quarantine if you have recently returned from traveling to a part of the country or the world where COVID-19 is spreading rapidly, or if you have knowingly been exposed to an infected person.
sq.involves-1: Using standard hygiene and washing hands frequently
sq.involves-2: Not sharing things like towels and utensils
sq.involves-5: Staying at least 6 feet away from other people in your household
sq.end_msg: Once your quarantine period has ended, if you do not have symptoms, follow your doctorâ€™s instructions on how to return to your normal routine.
